title: Additional Entity State Properties Update
contents:
mode_edit

Additional Entity State Properties Updatelink

We are going to see how to update the Additional Entity state properties. In the below example we are going to use the Entity Adapter example.

Usage:

we are declaring the selectedUserId as an additional entities state properties.

import { EntityState, EntityAdapter, createEntityAdapter } from '@ngrx/entity'; export interface User { id: string; name: string; } export interface State extends EntityState<User> { // additional entities state properties selectedUserId: number; } ... export const adapter: EntityAdapter<User> = createEntityAdapter<User>({ ... });

creating an action to update the selectedUserId

import { createAction, props, union } from '@ngrx/store'; import { Update } from '@ngrx/entity'; import { User } from '../models/user.model'; ... export const selectUser = createAction('[User/API] Select User', props<{ id: string }>()); ... const all = union({ ... selectUser, ... }); export type Union = typeof all;

The Additional entity state property can be updated same as a normal state property like below.

import { EntityState, EntityAdapter, createEntityAdapter } from '@ngrx/entity'; import { User } from '../models/user.model'; import * as UserActions from '../actions/user.actions'; export interface State extends EntityState<User> { // additional entities state properties selectedUserId: number | null; } export const adapter: EntityAdapter<User> = createEntityAdapter<User>(); export const initialState: State = adapter.getInitialState({ // additional entity state properties selectedUserId: null, }); export function reducer(state = initialState, action: UserActions.Union): State { switch (action.type) { ... case UserActions.selectUser.type: { return { ...state, selectedUserId: action.id}; } ... } } export const getSelectedUserId = (state: State) => state.selectedUserId;
